# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df[:ym] = Dates.yearmonth.(df[:dt]) .|> ym -> ym.year * 100 + ym.month
    return df
end
```

This function `add_yearmonth` adds a new column `ym` to the DataFrame `df` which is created by extracting the year and month from the `dt` column and concatenating them together as an integer in the format "yyyymm". The `Dates.yearmonth.` function is used to extract the year and month from each datetime in the `dt` column, and then a transformation is applied to convert this yearmonth object into an integer in the desired format. The `.|>` operator is used to pipe the result of the transformation directly into the assignment of the new column `ym`.
